content.question: Which of the following later developments would best support Copernicus’ claim regarding the motion of the spheres?

choices.label: Galileo’s observations of sunspots as well as craters on the moon
Kepler’s formulation of the laws of planetary motion
Brahe’s assertion that novas were not comets, but in fact newly visible stars

content.answer: Kepler’s formulation of the laws of planetary motion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
